DOC.brief_summary: Given availability aspheric diffractive IOLs vary negative spherical aberration may feasible , select best fit IOL , minimize aberration thereby maximize visual performance .
DOC.brief_title: Selection Aspheric Diffractive Multifocal Intraocular Lens ( IOLS ) Based Corneal Wavefront
DOC.criteria: 18 year age old Scheduled undergo bilateral cataract refractive lens surgery Visual potential 20/30 good eye lens removal IOL implantation Naturally dilate pupil size ( dim light ) > 3.5 mm ( dilation medication ) eye Preoperative regular corneal astigmatism 2.5 D less Clear intraocular medium cataract Availability , willingness , sufficient cognitive awareness comply examination procedures Ocular disease cataract could potentially limit uncorrected visual acuity visual performance . Astigmatism correctable limbal relaxing incision ( great 2.5 D ) Use systemic ocular medication may affect visual outcome Acute chronic disease illness would increase risk confound study result ( e.g . diabetes mellitus , immunocompromised , etc . ) Uncontrolled systemic ocular disease History ocular trauma prior ocular surgery Amblyopia strabismus Known pathology may affect visual acuity ; particularly retinal change affect vision ( macular degeneration , cystoid macular edema , proliferative diabetic retinopathy , etc . ) Diagnosed degenerative visual disorder ( e.g . macular degeneration , retinal disorder ) predict cause future acuity loss level bad 20/30 Subjects may expect require retinal laser treatment surgical intervention Capsule zonular abnormality may affect postoperative centration tilt lens ( e.g . pseudoexfoliation syndrome ) Pupil abnormality ( nonreactive , tonic pupil abnormally shape pupil ) Contact lens usage within 6 month PMMA lenses , 1 month gas permeable lens 1 week extendedwear dailywear soft lens Requiring intraocular lens power < 15.0 > 26.0 diopter
DOC.keyword: Patients schedule cataract lens replacement surgery implantation multifocal intraocular lens
